content.description: Which of the following would be an indication that the normality condition has been met for a <math alttext="t" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>t</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>-test for the slope of a regression model?
content.question: A residual plot with no apparent pattern in the residualsA histogram of the residuals that is centered at 0, unimodal, and symmetricA dotplot of the residuals that is centered at 0 and strongly skewed to the left with outliers

choices.label: <math alttext="1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>I </mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> and <math alttext="2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>II</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> only

<math alttext="2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>II</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> and <math alttext="3" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mtext>III</mtext></mrow></math> only

<math alttext="1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>I</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>, <math alttext="2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>II</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>, and <math alttext="3" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>III</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>

topic.text: 9.4: Setting Up a Test for the Slope of a Regression Model

skill.text: Skill 4.C: Verify that inference procedures apply in a given situation.
